conclusion: Ideal gas goes through states A, B, C; temperature at A is 200 K; find temperature at B.
Diagram is a pressure-volume (p-V) diagram with points A, B, C; pressures in 10^5 Pa, volumes in liters.
At point A: pressure is 1 x 10^5 Pa, volume is 2 L.
At point B: pressure is 4 x 10^5 Pa, volume is 2 L.
At point C: pressure is 1 x 10^5 Pa, volume is 5 L.
Use ideal gas law PV = nRT; n is constant.
From A to B: Pressure increases, volume constant.
From B to C: Pressure decreases, volume increases.
From C to A: Pressure constant, volume decreases.
Set up equation P_A V_A / T_A = P_B V_B / T_B.
Calculate left side: 1 x 10^3 = (4 x 10^5)(2) / T_B.
Check units: Pressure in Pa, volume in liters, temperature in Kelvin.
Convert liters to cubic meters: 1 L = 0.001 mÂ³.
Recalculate with converted units: (1 x 10^5 * 0.002) / (4 x 10^5 * 0.002) = 200 / T_B.
